title: Healing Word
content:
Healing Word Level 1 Evocation Spell 1~4 Healing 1d4+WIS/CHA Heal a creature you can see. No effect on undead and constructs. 18m Bonus Action Level 1 Spell Slot

Level 1 Evocation Spell

Heal a creature you can see.

No effect on undead and constructs.

Healing word is a Level 1 Evocation Spell in Baldur's Gate 3. It restores hit points at range and can be cast as a bonus action. Spells can be used for dealing damage to Enemies, inflict Status Ailments, buff Characters or interact with the environment.

Baldur's Gate 3 Healing Word Information

Description: Heal a creature you can see No effect on undead and constructs.

Level: Lvl 1 Spell School: Evocation Casting Time: Bonus Action Level 1 Spell Slot Range: 18m Requires Concentration: No

Healing Word Tips & Notes for BG 3

Upcast: When cast with a 2nd level spell slot or higher, the healing increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st. Healing Word will revive unconscious creatures with 0 hit points and is the best use of the spell in combat. Synergizes particularly well with magical items such as Hellrider’s Pride, Boots of Aid and Comfort and The Whispering Promise when cast in combat. Mechanically identical to the D&D5e version. Every cleric needs to have this in their deck, the ability to cast healing from a long distance on an ally allows you to not risk your own position being capitalized by your enemies, because of this functionality, you can safely cast this to bring someone back in the fight when they go down. Unlike Cure Wounds, Healing Word is a bonus action which allows you to squeeze a cantrip, spell or a mace to the face.
